column4: hey all.  I'm looking into options for setting up a softphone and getting a telephone number so when I am out of the country clients can ring me.  What are your thoughts on Dimondcard  and are there other alternatives for setting up a line to my computer?  On the linux side what program is best?  Empathy, Ekiga, Twinkle, etc?
Skype?
Works well
(other than skype .. ) =_
other than skype... Well... Emulation is out of the question, right? (Wine)
well I have virtualbox setup right now with windows xp.  I don't know enough about wine to be comfortable with it at this point.
I see...
norbert: (linux is the host, windows is the guest)
Hang on
If it is a viable alternative I'm open to it..
!vopi jasonmsp
!voip
Never heard of Gizmo5 though
yeah I'm reading the community docs on Ekiga now.
Is dimondcard the only provider or are there others/
If you need real phone access I guess Gizmo5 would be useful, otherwise I would recommend Mumble for voip transfer.
I have no idea unfortunetaly. I only used Skype so far
And I assume you live in the US, while I am sitting in EU. So I am not familiar with the providers either.. :(
well techinically I'm, in the middle east at the moment, but I tunnel into our servers in the US.
Yet, you might also consider Google's solution too
